## R Markdown


##Getting a Map object.
```{r}
test <- ggmap::get_stamenmap(bbox = c(left = 6.15, bottom = 49.10, right =
  6.20, top = 49.15), zoom = 14, maptype="watercolor")
#test <- ggmap::get_map(location = c(lon = 6.175754, lat = 49.120063 ), zoom = 13, maptype="watercolor")
ggmap::ggmap(test)
```


##Getting the data from the shapefiles
```{r}
unzip('SnowGIS_SHP.zip')
shapefile <- readOGR("SnowGIS_SHP/", "Cholera_Deaths.shp")
#shapefile <- readShapeSpatial('Cholera_Deaths.shp',proj4string = CRS("+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84"))
#shape <- sf::read_sf(dsn = ".", layer = "Cholera_Deaths.shp")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
